It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. Wolkensteinia is often cultivated by cactus enthusiasts for its striking appearance and resilience.
